nodes.bodyText: Should we update this file, across multiple plugin runs, in case the project config has changed in between? Either way, is it warranted to log an Info for this condition?

commit.message:
Fix IDE integrations for Windows

The verifyNode task only worked on macOS and Linux, and really isn't
necessary anyway. Kill it, and instead just try to run the command. If
it's missing, throw an error.

Also, throw an exception instead of printing the error. This has two
advantages: 1) the error is red and angry and obvious 2) the user can
try again via Android Studio without modifying the gradle.build file

commit.message:
Fix amplifyPush

This also didn't work! In order for this to run properly on Windows, the
JSON documents passed in via the command-line arguments must be escaped.
Also did some minor refactoring.

Set VERSION_NAME to master

This will allow local debugging via publishToMavenLocal.
